revised_title: Development of a Standard Unit for Ionization Measurement of Gamma-Radiation
tldr: The authors investigated the ionization measurement of gamma radiation to develop a standard unit for radiation therapy. They compared free-air and air-wall chambers and found that air-wall chambers were suitable for gamma-ray dosage measurement. The study aimed to establish a single unit of dosage for both X-ray and gamma-ray therapy, improving cancer treatment effectiveness.
